author: jerenkrantz
msg: Oh, that's nice.  If we don't have SSL support built-in, they get a generic
error message.  At least indicate that it isn't "implemented" - so, if we
see this with open_socket call, we know what it is.  (And with the recent
patch to print the URL, it'll be obvious when this happens.)

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Update flood build documentation to indicate that SSL support is no longer
(A code change is going into flood shortly to detect this and bug out,
but let's document it as well.)
